page.title: 02Local History.
page.content: Lambourn is famous for racing,but 40 years ago it wasn't so famous.There used to be only 12 stables but now there are 22.The railway was closed as it was losing money.It had been very popular and the horses were carried to the big races on the train.It was opened in 1899 and it was closed on January 2nd.1960.Many places were called'Chipping.....',so Lambourn was originally called 'Chipping Lambourne'.40 years ago the shops were very small and they would only sell their own goods.A man called John Carter tried to burn down the village on 3 occasions,but he was caught and hung.He was the last person to be hung.His tombstone is in the churchyard.In 1930 the present school in Greenways was started,but the Infants were at their own school in Close End.
